meaningMnemonic: When people <kanji>transmit</kanji> a <kanji>theory</kanji> through the ages, it can turn into a <vocabulary>legend</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>legendary story</vocabulary>. Kind of like how the "theory" of King Arthur's sword turned into the legend of Excalibur.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. You just have to remember that 伝 is read as でん in this case. Just imagine yourself sitting in your <reading>den</reading> (でん) as you get cozy and listen to this theory about a great <vocabulary>legend</vocabulary>.
